- [Meetup](/events-in-a-box/meetup)

Page.title: StrongLoop Meetup Event in a Box
Page._content:
The following Kit is designed to help you plan and execute a local meetup supporting StrongLoop including

  • Scheduling the meetup, identifying target audience, and driving attendance
    • Sample meetup organizer reach out
    • Sample meetup Follow-Up Thank You Note
  • Key Messaging
  • Ordering Swag
  • Ordering food and beverages
  • Reimbursement
  • Lead Follow-Up

Overview

Key Messaging

  • IBM and StrongLoop help grow support for, and investment in, the Node.js community through thought leadership, sponsorship of activities, and contributions to open source projects.
  • IBM and StrongLoop enable you to quickly develop and scale mobile, IoT and next-generation applications and APIs through our contributions to Node core, open source frameworks, and our DevOps tools.
  • You can use Node for the enterprise both on-prem and in the cloud with IBM Bluemix, providing full hybrid cloud support.
  • The combination of StrongLoop, IBM API Management, and IBM DataPower capabilities give you the most complete API platform in the industry.

What is a meetup?

  • A meetup is an informal gathering of people with a shared interest - usually a small to midsize amount of people. At a meetup a shared topic is discussed and knowledge is shared throughout the group. The objective of a meetup is to learn from the group, share your knowledge and network with people who have a shared interest as you.

Target Audience

  • JavaScript developers
  • Node.js developers
  • Any developer interested in learning more about StrongLoop, Node.js, or Bluemix

StrongLoop SMEs

Joe Sepi | Raymond Camden | Erin McKean | David Okun

Presentation Topic Ideas

  • Developing REST APIs in Node using LoopBack
  • Build, Deploy, Scale and Triage Node.js
  • Deploying and Monitoring Node on Bluemix with StrongLoop
  • Debugging and Profiling Node.js
  • Introduction to Node.js

Demo and Video

  • StrongLoop and Bluemix Integration Demo
  • StrongLoop Arc Demo
  • Getting started with LoopBack

On-Site Support

StrongLoop Swag

For StrongLoop swag to give away at the meetup please contact Dave Whiteley at least three weeks prior to the meetup.

See below for an example of what you can order to give away at the meetup:

StrongLoop Stickers

StrongLoop T-Shirts

Food and Beverage 

For sponsorship of food and beverage at the meetup please contact Alex Muramoto at least two weeks prior to the event

StrongLoop Logo and PowerPoint Template

Please use StrongLoop logo and PowerPoint template for all presentation material for proper look and feel:

StrongLoop PowerPoint Template V1 10-9-15.ppt|View Details

   Timeline
2-4 Months Out
  • Contact meetup organizer to secure a speaking slot and sponsorship.
2 Months Out
  • Contact Alex Muramoto to finalize sponsorship and begin promotion of meetup.
  • Check with local IMT marketing team to fund. (We will ICA IMT quarterly for marketing spend).
  • Brief local IMT team and discuss lead follow up.
  • Drive attendance of the event by Tweeting out registration link and using hashtag "StrongLoop" and hashtag "IBMandStrongLoop". Work with IBM Application Platform social media team (Louis La Plante and Melissa Love) and the StrongLoop social media contact (Dave Whiteley) to help drive registration through social media and to post any fun imagery during and after the event.
1 Month Out
  • Contact Alex Muramoto to acquire StrongLoop swag to give away at meetup and coordinate funding for food and beverages. (See above for example of StrongLoop swag that can be ordered to give away).
  • Review proposed presentation topic and content with Alex Muramoto or Raymond Camden.
1 Week Out 
  • Finalize presentation content for meetup.
  • Integrate proper StrongLoop logo and look and feel into all presentation material. (See above for StrongLoop logo and PowerPoint Template).
  • Confirm day, time, and expected attendance.
Day Before
  • Confirm swag was delivered (either you or the meetup organizer).
  • Order food and beverage (based on expected attendance).
Day of Meetup
  • Show up early!
  • Set up swag table and put out attendee sign-in sheet (and collect it at the end) and CTEBA notice. Below is the CTEBA Notice and a sign-in sheet that you can use:
  • StrongLoop MeetUp CTEBA Notice V1 12-18-15.pdf|View Details
  • StrongLoop MeetUp Sign Up Sheet V1 12-17-15.doc|View Details
  • Engage before and after your talk.
1-4 Days After
  • Send attendee list to Charles (Andy) Dominguez for follow-up.
  • Submit expense report for reimbursement (if paid by you). 
  • Best way is via IBM AmEx or send in an invoice.

Troubleshooting

How much pizza should I order?
Typically, free meetups will have a 40-60% attrition rate. That means that if you have 60 RSVPs, only expect 25-35 people to show up.
What do you do if you only have 3 or 5 people RSVPed for the meetup? Do you still have the meetup?
This is a difficult decision, but in general, yes! You never know who will show up at the last minute. That said, you should immediately contact Dave Whiteley to generate some buzz and get more people out.
What if I have to cancel a meetup?
This is unfortunate, but the first step is let the meetup organizer know as soon as possible so they can find a replacement.
Next, try to see if you can secure a speaking slot in a later month.
Be sure to contact Dave Whiteley and anyone else involved in the promotion of the event so they can stop the campaign and send a cancellation notice.

Sample StrongLoop Meetup Organizer Reach Out 

Hello (Meetup Organizer Name):

My name is (name) and I work for IBM on (team). I'd love to present at a meetup for your group on (topic). IBM is investing in the Node, JavaScript, and general developer community and is happy to sponsor the event with food and beverages!

The general idea for my talk would be (topic abstract or explanation)

Please let me know if that would be interesting to your group and when you might have a speaking slot open!

Thanks,

(name)

Sample StrongLoop Meetup Follow-Up Thank You Note

Hello (Attendee Name):

Thank you so much for attending our StrongLoop meetup on (meetup Topic) at (meetup Location)! We hope you enjoyed the event and were able to learn and expand your network and Node.js knowledge. If you'd like to learn more about Node and StrongLoop, check out our getting started page.

If you have a question that wasn't answered or want to discuss the topic further reach out to me!

I hope to see you at another meetup in the future!

Sincerely,

(name)
